WRITING.TEXT: Anorexia is not a diet though :/
Ahahahaha you got me there

I just hate feeling hungry and fatigued. Don't get me wrong, I like feeling *empty* as in, my stomach is flat and concave. But I don't like hunger. I'm more that capable of restricting, I wish I just weren't so damn tired and cranky all the time.

Kind of reminds me how in Twilight, Edward (well all the vampires really) couldn't eat. Like wow what a time to be alive. I wish I literally couldn't eat. I'd be so damn skinny. Not only do I wish I couldn't eat, I wish I simply didn't need food and didn't get hungry.

How I feel all day is determined by what the scale says as soon as I wake up. If it's higher, I feel like shit all day. If it's lower, I may as well have snorted some coke because I am HIGH ON LIFE if I weigh less. I know that if I don't restrict, the scale will be up in the morning and it'll make me miserable.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: 1 cup vanilla Greek yoghurt (80), 1 stick cheese (80)
Dinner: 88g frozen veggies (60), 2 vegetarian sausage patties (140)
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson (317)
Total: 360-317 = **43 net calories**
My Wii U!

I've been trying to save up for an Xbox One because my ex used to play GTA a lot and it looked so fun! But I've been wasting my money on stupid, useless crap. If at the end of May I have some extra money left over, I'm buying that damn Xbox. It'll keep me entertained all summer! Until then, Mario Kart and the Sims 4 will have to keep me busy.
Yo I just posted something like this the other day. [Here's the link](https://www.reddit.com/r/proED/comments/4g54a1/what_do_you_guys_do_all_day/) for some ideas!

What. What what what???
The last month for me on MFP has been 0-700 calories. Am I at risk for being banned??

Yeah my mom's food is the one thing I'll never throw away. Because one day I *might* eat it (no plans in the near future tbh) and her food is sentimental more than anything. She puts so much time and love into her food. She cooked it all for me while she was visiting me, when she could have been out doing things with her boyfriend instead!
I wish I could somehow fit it into my calorie budget, even if it's only a few spoonfuls. But I literally have no idea what the calorie count would be. She doesn't use measuring tools really (her idea of a tablespoon is a large soup spoon lol). The basmati rice is the only thing I'd be able to measure out and calculate the calories. I mean I guess I could weigh the total amount of potato curry and figure out how many calories come from the potato, but for oil, garlic, ginger, etc I'd have *no* idea. She used coconut oil **and** vegetable oil to make it!!!

UGH potatoes are life. Seriously. What makes the cravings worse is that I have a few servings of my mom's potato curry in my freezer. I could eat it almost anytime I wanted to. It's like I'm so close yet so far.

What's triggering your binges? Do your restrict too low to start with? When I used to binge it would be because I'd restrict myself way too much during the day, come home from school and be ravenous. I'd eat whatever was binge-able. My mentality was always "I'll try again tomorrow." Then I'd restrict myself the next day, become absolutely ravenous and eat everything all over again. It was a horrible cycle and I ended up gaining *so much* weight. Just try to remind yourself the next time you want to binge, how it'll read on the scale in the future.

Shark week was last week for me and I was OK when it came to cravings and hunger. I got off my period maybe on Sunday? Saturday? IDR but since Sunday I've just wanted to eat everything! I woke up in the middle of the night Sunday (early Monday morning technically) *craving* potatoes. Seriously, I could like, feel the consistency of my mom's potato curry in my mouth almost. Gah! I've refrained quite well but even when I'm not hungry I want to eat.
I made a normal non-low sodium version in my slow cooker over the winter. It was great! When I write my grocery list for next week I'll consider adding the ingredients to my list.
Fingers crossed! I'm really watching my sodium today so hopefully that helps.
I guess he's not that stable considering he's a rapist makes sense I suppose. Putting women down and shit.

For me, it's all about the scale. I discussed this in someone's else thread. I woke up feeling relatively slim today. I had 390 calories yesterday so I hoped the scale would reflect that. But the scale read .4 *higher* yesterday. It's quite literally impossible for me to have gained almost half a pound overnight, especially considering I only ate 390 calories the day before. But after that scale reading, I felt huge. That scale reading means nothing in the grand scheme of things. But the number itself indicates how I feel throughout the day. I feel fat and disgusting today. On the flip side, if the scale read .4 pounds *lighter*, I would feel beautiful and thin. I look in the mirror and see fat everywhere. But if the scale reading was lower, I would probably think I look slimmer whenever I look in the mirror.

Personally, I just want to be underweight. When I was diagnosed with anorexia as a teenager, my BMI (based on the "old" formula) was between 17.4 and 16.4 (my mom took my scale away at 17.4 and I lost ~5 pounds after she took it away making it 16.4). So my lowest was ~87. My goal weight is 85 just because I want a new low weight. Of course I'd love to go even lower but I doubt I'd be able to continue riding if I got lower. But we'll see how I feel once I reach my goal!
Ah, yes that's a good point.

Breakfast: Protein powder (120) + 8 oz unsweetened vanilla almond milk (30)
Lunch: 1 oz cheese (80)
Dinner: 88g frozen veggies (60)
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson (216)
Total: 290-216 = **74 net calories**
This is all what I have planned. I *might* up my intake so I can do 30 minutes of cardio as well, but we'll see.
Anytime babe! 3

I can totally empathize with you. When I've been in loving relationships in the past, the relationship totally shut down my ED brain. It's a blessing and a curse! I hope you're able to reach your goals post period.

Are you eating foods high in sodium? Are you properly weighing and measuring your food? You should be losing around 1.5 pounds a week so that's strange. Also, you exercise a lot. I know you said yoga but sometimes even cardio can stall fat loss if you don't change your cardio routine up every now and then. If you do any weight training, that can cause water retention.

You can gain up to 5% of your body weight during your period so don't worry about it! Your BMR is different from your TDEE so as long as you eat less than you TDEE, you will lose weight. Based on your stats I'd imagine 1400 is way below your TDEE. Your body is probably not used to the 1400 calories you had so it'll take time for that 1400 calories of water weight to die down. Once your period ends you should be going back to losing steadily. Try not to worry too much about it! Trust me, I know it's easier said than done. I had 390 calories yesterday and I'm up .4 pounds this morning! Just remind yourself it'll all even out eventually.

Similarly, I went on to date the guy who raped me (stupid, I know). We were 3 months into dating and he said something about my weight followed by, "You don't want to be a size 8 forever" (I was 15-20 pounds heavier back then). It triggered the fuck out of me and prompted me to break up with him. Funny how something weight related made me break up with him but not the fact he fucking raped me. I mean I can't *really* blame him for saying that. I was a size 8 and he was fucking ripped. Why would a ripped guy want to date a size 8 girl?

WRITING.TITLE: No soup for you!
WRITING.TEXT:
And by *you* I mean *me*.
I had 1 cup of soup for dinner on Sunday and 1 cup last night. Yesterday morning I was down .8 pounds but this morning I'm UP .4 pounds! I drank a ton of water last night (64 oz to be exact) and took a diuretic and peed like a dozen times before I went to bed to balance the sodium from the soup but it failed. Gahhh I feel like shit. I had a feeling this would happen which is why I put off having soup for so long, but I'm not grocery shopping until all my safe foods are gone and soup ~~is~~ was one of my safe foods. I'm never having soup again...despite how delicious and low cal it is.
Overused Seinfeld quotes aside, I'm really upset about my weight being up today! I know it's water weight because there's literally no way I gained almost half a pound by eating 390 calories yesterday. But still. I was so motivated after seeing the scale read 116.6 yesterday and I really want to hit 115 by Monday! I think I might fast one or two days this week to make it happen. 500 calories seems too high for me to eat, but if I can hit that calorie goal, I might try to workout a little bit today as well. It was rainy and windy yesterday so I couldn't go on a run but today seems pretty okay. Oh, and I'm riding today so that'll help.
Well no that negative reinforcement is kind of good! It's a reality check in a way because like you will get really fuckin' sick without the protein :o

I already feel like I'm at the point where I'm unable to stop. Even if I made the decision to maintain for a while, I don't think I could do it. I struggle to even meet 400 or 500 calories a day so I can work out :(
I fail to hydrate myself properly so it's critical for me to load up on water if I want to see the scale go down in the morning. Hm, I should up my water intake.

If I eat foods high in sodium I have a compulsion to drink like 4 bottles of water afterwards so the scale budges in the morning. I've been getting in the habit of taking a diuretic after I eat dinner as well which is something I should probably stop :|

I never really thought about it but I don't like eating anything after 7pm, so usually whatever would be considered "dinner" happens between 6 and 6:30. I like going to bed with my stomach concave, so that's the only reason. Plus it gives me a chance to drink a lot of water and pee as much as possible before my morning weigh-in. When I eat again greatly depends on what I have going on the next day. At the earliest I'll eat at 9am.

:o
Well I'll definitely add some chicken and more Greek yoghurt to my shopping list next week!!!

Yeah I didn't mention the whole athlete thing to the person who corrected me on /r/loseit. I ride horses 4x a week pretty intensely so I'd imagine I'd need more protein than someone who is sedentary/eating enough protein to maintain good health. But with restricting I really don't care that much :/ however I'm trying to get more protein in to maintain my muscle instead of seeing it go to mush.
Welcome to the community! I hope you're able to find the support you need 3 Also, I live in Vegas so if you need any suggestions for August, let me know!

I'd imagine you're going to the creperie after Chinese food, right? Maybe when you get to the creperie just say you're too full to eat something after all the Chinese food. Maybe get a coffee so you don't feel too left out. I don't care much for Chinese food and I can't really make out the menu, but maybe, as /u/pumpkin-poodle suggested, get a meat dish (preferably chicken or fish) that's relatively dry (grilled would be best if possible) and skip out on the rice/noodles. If your friends get suspicious just say you're on a low-carb/keto kick.

No it was definitely pounds.
specific bulking goals rather than just wanting to keep your hair from falling out, etc.
If you don't have bulking goals but are an athlete, I'd imagine you'd need more protein than that though, right? Because you're constantly straining your muscles and would need a bit more protein to repair your muscles after participating in the sport?

Maybe someone can correct me on this but I thought it's supposed to be x protein per pound of *lean* body mass? So if you know your bf%, get your lean mass number and multiply that by .6 or .8? Someone over at /r/loseit corrected me when I said it was overall mass, not lean mass and directed me towards a Harvard article. However, I feel like that would be *such little* protein if you did it based on lean mass. When I count macros, I can't imagine eating less than 80g protein per day.
3 take care of yourself darling

Breakfast: Vanilla Greek yoghurt (80)
Lunch: ????? nothing planned yet
Dinner: 1 cup soup (70) + 5 crackers (60)
Total: 210
I want my total to be 400 so I can run a mile today and burn off ~100, but I really don't know what else to eat to get to 400. I have limited food choices since I'm not grocery shopping until all my safe foods are gone.

Yes. Exactly this. Yesterday I had 400 calories instead of my usual ~300 and I felt like shiiiiiit. Luckily I'm down .8 pounds from yesterday but still! I'm trying to up my intake to 500 so I can exercise more but 500 seems too high for me. It's so fucking dumb. I've been thinking about maintaining for a while so my mom doesn't get suspicious of my rapid weigh loss but...nah. I have a compulsion to keep going.
Yes exactly. I think it's important for people in recovery to learn that no food is off limits (aside for the instance of an allergy, as you mentioned).

* Height: 5'1"
* CW: 116.6
* HW: 158
* LW: 87-92 (my mom took my scale away at 92 but I still lost weight hence the range)
* GW: 100
* UGW: 85
* WL: 17 in total
* BMI: 23.01 (new), 22.03 (old)
* Age: 22
* Gender expression: F
I was 117.4 yesterday morning and I'm super surprised I woke up today .8 pounds lighter. My goal for May 1st is to be 115 which I think is more than doable. I reckon I'll be in the 114's by then. Hopefully by the end of *next* week I'll have reached my lowest adult weight of 111!

I remember reading an article a few days ago about the struggles of eating disorder recovery (it was one of those Odyssey website articles I think) and like *all* the top comments were "go vegan :)". IDK in the past whenever I'd talk to my therapist about even just going vegetarian (for moral purposes, not to restrict my diet) she would say things like "I think you need to be a little more recovered to do that" etc. But then there was this one girl in my eating disorder recovery group who (no judgement) was still emaciated from anorexia raving about HCLF raw veganism...Call me crazy but I feel like weight restoration is something that should be done *before* someone changes their diet to something extreme and super restrictive.

What you're experiencing is bradycardia (low heart rate). I experience the other extreme, tachycardia (rapid heart rate), when I've been restricting/fasting. Either of these things are very common with restrictive type eating disorders. Since you are not getting the nourishment your body needs, your heart needs to work harder to keep you alive, therefore the irregular heartbeat. In your case, I'd say your heart is not functioning properly and is having a very very difficult time maintaining a normal heart rate. In theory, yes, you should be concerned. Irregular heartbeats should not be taken lightly. But, truthfully and unfortunately, with eating disorders come the stupid ability to ignore signals your body gives you that something is wrong. Really, the only fix for this (as far as I know) is to stop restricting/fasting.

That's literally exactly what it is. During one of the cycles of eating disorder recovery group I was in, there was this one girl who raved about how HCLF raw veganism is what helped her recover from anorexia. My therapist would nod in agreement and smile whenever the girl talked about it and I just looked at my therapist [like](http://i.imgur.com/BAelVjY.jpg).....

Similarly, I was wondering about all these recovered anorexics turning to the HCLF raw vegan diet? I mean I feel like it's counter productive and also it's basically trading one food-related obsession for another? Idk HCLF raw veganism really restricts your diet, kind of like an eating disorder does. I don't see how that's (mentally) healthy for someone who had anorexia.

Oh my goodness I thought I was one of the few people on this sub who felt this way. I've recently reached a grey area in my eating disorder where on one hand, my ED has gotten *so* bad. In the past when I'd restrict, I'd still go out with friends and eat normally and have a "fuck it" mentality, then go back to restricting the next day. But I'm at a point where I refuse to see my friends all together because, food. On the other hand, I can finally see how badly I need help and how this will literally kill me if I don't stop. But I'm so stuck between the two.
Before I relapsed, I tried to lose weight the healthy way. But it triggered me to go back to ED behaviors and here I am. It's a lose lose situation all around. Maybe seeing a therapist will help you? Even if you're not committed to recovery, it might still be helpful to have 1 hour a week where you can totally speak your mind to another person.
You know, I was thinking about having popcorn at the movie theatre and making that the only food I'm allowed that day. But I'm scared! All the salt and butter! Gah. 3

I used to go on ultimate guitar and find chords to some songs, transpose them without the capo and sing along! It's pretty easy to figure out the chords if you have a concept of scales. I'll try that! I have a beginner's classical music piano song book as well that I'll pull out!

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: Balance bar (210)
Dinner: 1 cup soup (70) 5 crackers (60)
Exercise: Horseback riding lesson (258)
Total: 340-258 = **82 net calories**

Haha funny you mention that. I started playing piano when I was 6 but gave it up as a teenager. However, throughout my teenage years, I was a classical and musical theatre singer. I have a piano at home so maybe I'll dip back into that! Thank you!
I have never heard of that. My therapist has been suggesting yoga to me for years, so I'll look into that. Thank you!
Such a great surprise! Thank you and good luck with your fast! 3

I was thinking about something similar to this last night. Specifically, I was thinking about all the times people would tell me "just eat!" or "why don't you just eat healthy if you want to lose weight?" My response in my head is, well, if I *could* just eat healthy, don't you think I would? It's not like I enjoy isolating myself and being hungry and starved and emotionally fucked, just to see the number on the scale go down. If I could just eat, then I absolutely would. But I can't! I want to eat. I want to be normal. But my ED brain won't let me and it's really fucking awful. Plus, before my relapse, I *did* try to lose weight the healthy way and it just triggered me to go back to eating disordered behaviors. So clearly it's a much more complex problem than simply refusing to eat healthily.
Weigh* sorry for the typo in the title!

WRITING.TITLE: I weight less than I thought I did!!!!
WRITING.TEXT:
So as some of you may know based on my previous posts and comments, my mom and her boyfriend visited me 2 weekends ago (April 7-10) then the following weekend (April 15-17) I went out of town with them. I definitely gained weight between April 7 and 10 so I fasted and restricted until my trip with them on the 15th. I weighed myself the day I departed for my trip and I was around 120 or 121, meaning 1-2 pounds heavier than I was before they visited. I didn't weigh myself after my trip because I knew I'd cry at the number (I figured it would be around 125 with water weight and possible real weight gain) and have just been fasting and restricting since Monday.
I wasn't going to weigh myself until Friday since I'm on my period, but this morning I bit the bullet and stepped on the scale. I thought I'd be 120 at the *least* but the scale read 117.4! Holy crap! I'm so happy! And this is considering I'm still slightly on my period! That means I'm ~6 pounds away from my lowest adult weight. Now I really wish I had weighed myself after my trip to see the progress and how much I actually lost in 6 days. Oh well. I'm just so happy! I still have a *loooooong* way to go until I reach my lowest weight ever (which was between 87 and 92 when I was 14 years old) but this is so motivating.
Knowing this, I'm going to set myself a very conservative goal of reaching 115 by Monday May 2nd, however I reckon I'll be in the 114's. This also means, if my calculations are correct, I'll be under 100 pounds by the time of this wedding I've been invited to. Wow.
On the downside, I hate how much my mom's visit and going out of town stalled my weight loss. I was 119 on April 6 and I'm 117.4 on April 24. I could be like 110 by now had that visit and trip not happened.
DAMN rainbowsunshinedust! Back at it again with the cute as fuck posts!!! Love you, too.

Are you sure you're tracking your calories correctly? Unless you have a major medical issue (which you should see your doctor for asap to get checked out) I don't see how it's possible for you to not be loosing even on 600 calories a day. Are you eating foods high in sodium? That may not cause weight gain/maintenance but it definitely causes water retention.

Oh yes! I've seen those coloring books. I ought to get some. I am on Pinterest but I'm not super crafty. But who knows, I might get some inspiration. I used to volunteer at an animal shelter, I should look into doing that again. Thanks!!!
Of course 3
Yours look lovely! It really sucks how we can't pick and chose where we lose weight from though :(

I don't see how glorification of unhealthy body types is helpful to those in recovery
I'd say 99% of people who frequent this sub are not in recovery. Your argument is invalid.

My waist, on the other hand, just gets smaller and smaller. I'm way too heavy to have visible ribs, but here they are.
I'm the exact same way. My ribs are sooo prominent and so are my collar bones. But what good is that? Unless I wear skin tight tops, it's not like anyone else can see my ribs.
Ohhh okay I thought you meant she'd be 30 minutes away when she's in Napa! I hope she stays somewhat close to you!

Thigh gap is last on my list *only* because I seem to lose from my thighs the least when I lose weight. It's always my stomach/midsection, arms then thighs. I mean, I've recently developed a really nice keyhole gap but developing that took 10-15 pounds of a loss. So I'm guessing I won't see major thigh gap development until I've lost another 20-30 pounds.
Oh do you live in California?
Yeah for sure. If I weren't dealing with depression on top of the ED relapse, I would be able to manage. But both at the same time is like being hit by a bag of bricks!

You should totally start up archery! That's something I've wanted to try but never made the effort for it. Seriously, picking up a new hobby can turn into something amazing. When I started riding I flopped around on a horse once a week, then a year and a half later I bought my own horse and we go to big shows. It's incredible. Seriously. Start the archery!!!
I like white wines which I think are 120 calories per 5 oz? I could be wrong.
Aw I'm sorry your mom is leaving you!! But on the bright side, think of all the amazing wine she can make if she does move to a vineyard in Napa. Holy crap. But you are seriously so lucky that you have your mom living with you, making you all the wine you could ever want.
I know Magic is a card game but that reminds me I have the Sims 4 on my laptop and I haven't played in months haha I'm sure I could spend hours with that game. Thanks for the suggestions!

But I only get to do it if I burn off the calories before I drink it.
You know what, I may not go to the gym anymore but I still ride my horse 4 times a week. That burns anywhere between 200 and 400 calories. Meaning, I could *probably* get away with a glass or two of wine on days I ride!
Does your mom have a vineyard?

UGH I want some of you mom's wine. Wine is kind of a "fear food" of mine simply because I hate the thought of drinking my calories. But with restricting and fasting comes the inability to sleep well, so maybe working on getting over my fear will help me be happy (yay wine!) and sleep better! Haha

Hm. Well it's possible she is simply jealous that you're getting skinny, and fears that you'll out-skinny her - if that makes sense? Or maybe she senses you have an ED and that's her way of hinting it.

I know. They look overly sweet and sugar laden. I really really miss alcohol. Especially wine. I've been considering budgeting my allowed calories to fit it in. However, eating so few calories gets me wasted so quickly, and I fear that once I have 1 glass of wine, drunk subject6956 will convince me it'll be a good idea to have an entire bottle.
That sounds really cool! I've heard of people infusing their vodka with skittles and jolly ranchers but fruit and actual real flavors sound so much more appealing.
Is this coworker heavier than you by any chance?

infusing my own vodka
What do you infuse it with? Like fruit? That sounds really interesting! Yeah I don't like leaving the house much either, it's too exhausting :(

Again, thanks for your concern. If this was a sub dedicated to recovery, then you'd be rightfully concerned. However, it is not, so your arguments are invalid. Many of us aspire to look like the girls in the pictures I posted, so what exactly is your argument? Would you be saying something like this over in /r/fitness when someone posts pictures of a six pack? I've made the decision to end this conversation as you are not contributing anything to this post or to the sub overall.

Regarding reading, I actually started reading a book on my plane ride and I've totally forgotten about it! I'll definitely revisit it. It might be hard to focus on the text with so little food but maybe I'll make myself a cup of tea while I read.
Your idea of knitting sparked my memory of when I used to make those string friendship bracelets. I'll try to stop by the store this weekend and buy some string. Actually I might have some already...
My friends are so stressful. I really only have 2 friends and both of them know about my ED and my relapse, so it'll be hard to see them without food being involved. Plus one of them is out of the country for the next month so that really limits socializing for me.
Thank you so much for all of the suggestions!

I quoted myself because you kept asking the same question when I've already answered it.
Think of it this way. Many people with eating disorders have a fascination with thinness. We see hip bones, collar bones, rib cages, etc. to be really, really beautiful, when the general population probably doesn't think a skeletal person looks beautiful. We want to share our fascination with a skeletal physique with others since most people in our lives would be disgusted if we told them "bones are beautiful". And that's what this sub can be used for.

We all struggle with eating disorders and this is our only outlet, our own way to cope.
In addition, get support from others when it comes to the unhealthy behaviors we engage in. We ask others if they've experienced things similar to what we're going through. Eating disorders, as you must know, are very lonely disorders. We are not ready to recover and it kind of gives us hope and allows to feel less lonely knowing there are others going through what we're going through.

WRITING.TITLE: What do you guys do all day?
WRITING.TEXT:
I've found myself in a predicament where I have...nothing to do. I'm in school Monday-Thursday and I get home from campus at around 4:30pm. I don't have homework or studying to do every night so 3 out of 4 school nights leave me with at least 5 hours of nothingness. Mostly I just browse Reddit with the TV on as background noise and shower at some point. On the weekends it's even worse. I have maybe 2 hours max of homework for the *whole* weekend and I ride my horse. I ride earlier in the day meaning I'm back home no later than 1pm. That leaves me with at least 9 hours of nothing to do.
Lately I've been fasting a lot and restricting to under 300 calories a day, so it doesn't leave me with much energy to workout, especially if I've ridden earlier in the day. I have TV shows I'm behind on but my depression has gotten the worst of me and I have no interest in those shows anymore. Seeing friends is out of the question because I refuse to be around unsafe foods. I kind of wish my house was messy right now because it's a big house and it would take all day to clean, but it's really organized and spotless.
To top it off, the semester ends in a few weeks so I'll have periods of days where I'm doing absolutely nothing. There's this movie theatre nearby that sells tickets to all movies for $5 on Tuesdays. I've been thinking about adding that once a week but even smelling popcorn is so terrifying. I feel like I'm inhaling calories (so stupid, I know). Any ideas for me? I'm totally out of ideas.

Yo, I was literally just thinking about this yesterday. I haven't weighed myself since *last* Thursday because I went out of town Friday-Sunday and put on water weight and probably some real weight. I decided I'd fast and restrict all week to get rid of the weight I gained over that weekend trip and weigh myself on Friday. But then on Wednesday I got my period! So I knew my scheduled Friday weigh-in would be an inaccurate/water weight ridden reading. So I've decided I'm going to put my weigh-in off for another week.
I've been restricting and fasting consistently since Monday and I have no intention to stop. I know logically I've lost weight, but not knowing the number makes me feel fat, despite being able to feel and see my ribs better than I've been able to in over a year. By the time I weigh myself next Friday, I'll have lost even more weight. So up until the second I step on the scale, I'm going to feel fat. But once I get the reading and see it's way lower, I'll feel skinny. Like, flip of a switch my body perception will change. It's such a mindfuck.

Yeah I'm this way when I'm fasting. The first 24 hours are the worst, then my mood stabilizes the following day. The only fix to this I have is trying to limit my social interactions. Even getting texts and Facebook notifications really irritates me during the first 24 hours of a fast. I don't know why, I guess it's just because I don't have the energy to deal with people and I'd rather be left totally alone to endure my fast.

Breakfast: Nothing
Lunch: 1 oz cheese (80)
Dinner: Something to keep me under 300 calories for the day
Exercise: Horse riding (217)
Total: 300-217 = **83 net calories**
Ugh I know! Her shoulders, too!

I appreciate your concern but you have to understand the audience of this sub. We all struggle with eating disorders and this is our only outlet, our own way to cope. I'd say 90% of us know and understand how damaging eating disorders are and the consequences that come with fasting, restricting purging, bingeing, etc. I was diagnosed with anorexia nervosa when I was 14. I am 22 now and have continued to struggle with the disorder and body dysmorphia all these years later. I don't think you fully understand the purpose of this sub.

800 calories per day is less than the recommended 1000-1200 minimum for women so I'm sure those 200 calories you're missing has had an effect. Especially if long-term you've been doing this. If you are really concerned and think it may be non-diet related, maybe ask your doctor.
I find that coffee makes fasting so much easier. However, I've abused coffee a bit too much so I'm trying to stay away from it for a while haha.

WRITING.TITLE: I created a Thinspo folder last night and I thought I'd share some here. Have a wonderful weekend!

WRITING.TEXT:
I haven't experienced that exactly with my period, but any relatively long term restricting and fasting (malnourishment really) can definitely cause period issues. But are you sure it was a period and not just spotting? In the past, even before I got to my lowest weight/underweight, I had been restricting for several months and I got my period as scheduled, but then 2 weeks later I got a full period again.
Have you tried fasting to help your weight pudge? There will be days where I'm stuck at the same exact weight (down the the fraction of a pound) for 3 days. I fast for 24-36 hours then weight loss resumes. Lately I've been getting plateaus a lot, despite eating under 500 calories, so I have to fast 2-3 times a week to get the scale moving.
You are so adorable and I love this post so much omg good night darling!!

Yes. Food is fucking expensive. Being an athlete makes it even more expensive. Before I relapsed I was spending around $150 on groceries every week!!!!!!! Yes, that included things like food for my cats, litter, etc. but still! A lot! Proud of you though for taking a step towards recovery. Best wishes! 3

This is really interesting. On most online calculator type things, they say to measure your wrist to determine your frame size. I have super tiny wrists so I've been under the impression that my frame is small. I had no idea frame size is based on the other measurements you listed. Do you know of any online calculator thingies that tell you your frame sized based on hip bone distance and rib circumference?

I really don't know why this happens. I guess the stomach gets used to such small quantities, so when it gets larger quantities, it is surprised initially? Maybe someone else can better explain this :3
SAME. I could have a huge cold, refreshing salad for the same amount of calories but I prefer small quantities of food. Weird ED thing I have.
